C1 a set of stairs inside a building, usually with a bar fixed on the wall or onto vertical poles at the side for you to hold on to: She descended the sweeping (= long and wide) staircase into the crowd of photographers and journalists. A spiral staircase leads up to the second floor.
pigphoto/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe ballroom is dominated by an enormous marble staircase.They climbed the wooden staircase into the roof space.An original grand staircase also was preserved.
